intro: Costus lacerus, commonly known as the broken costus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric, and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features narrow, strap-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
